quest.name: They Came from the Deep
journal: R'ashaht Rhiki has an urgent duty to press upon a conveniently available adventurer.

Commander Rhiki relays to you the disturbing details of a civilian ship sunk in the Strait of Merlthor. Suspecting Sahagin involvement, she asks that you report to the Maelstrom soldier in charge of the rescue operation. Make your way to Bloodshore in eastern La Noscea, and speak with Private Wilfalk.

You report to Private Wilfalk, who wastes no time in assigning you the duty of tending to the wounded and exhausted survivors washed up on the sand. Use the Maelstrom field potions supplied to you by Wilfalk if the victims of the attack appear injured.
You have tended to the traumatized victims. Report back to Private Wilfalk.

No sooner have you returned to the private than a band of Sahagin appears before you. Rather than inflict any further grief, it seems the beastmen are singularly intent on seeing a young boy to safety. Speak with Robyn, and seek to understand this perplexing turn of events.

According to Robyn, the Sahagin who saved him were not the same “scary fishmen” that attacked the ship. The boy also appears to have found a necklace belonging to one of his saviors, and asks that you return it to its beastman owner. Find Novv's Nursery in western La Noscea, and show the trinket to the settlement's wary young guard.
The young Sahagin acknowledges your honorable intentions, and invites you to enter the nursery. Find and speak with the settlement's chief, Clutchfather Novv.

Delighted by the return of his cherished necklace, Clutchfather Novv welcomes you to his home. It appears that you have stumbled upon a rare clutch of Sahagin─a group that isn't immediately interested in spilling your lifeblood on the ground. Speak with Novv to learn what you may about this unusually hospitable beastman settlement.
objectives: Use Maelstrom field potions on injured survivors.
Show the shark tooth necklace to the Sahagin spawnling at the entrance to Novv's Nursery in western La Noscea.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: Your hearing must be exceptional, [GC Rank] SurnameForename. Hm? If you did not overhear the linkpearl report, then why─ Well, no matter.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: You are here now, and we could certainly use your aid. I have just received word that raiders have sunk a civilian vessel in the Strait of Merlthor.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: One of our warships is en route as we speak...though I fear there will be little left for them to find.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: I am uncomfortably familiar with tales of pirates looting─and even commandeering─their targets, but to sink the ship entire? An excessively brutal act, even for a buccaneer.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: No, I'd wager cold hard coin that those thrice-damned fishbacks are behind this─them and their Serpent Reaver lackeys. The Sahagin have much to answer for...

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: Vengeance will be forthcoming, but let us first focus on rescuing what poor souls we may. While the warship scours the waters, I would have you head to eastern La Noscea and look for any survivors washed up on the sands of Bloodshore.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: One of my soldiers, Private Wilfalk, has been deployed to coordinate the search. Speak with him when you arrive, and he will direct your efforts to where they are most needed. May Llymlaen guide your steps.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: I'd prefer naught more than to gut a few score fishbacks and leave their corpses rotting on the beach, but our rescue efforts must come first. Make your way to Bloodshore and search the shallows for survivors!

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: Yer the one Commander Rhiki said to expect, then? I'm Wilfalk, a private in the commander's Foreign Levy.

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: As ye can see, there ain't much for me to coordinate. The fishbacks made a good mess o' that ship─seems barely a handful o' the poor buggers what were sailin' on it made it ashore alive.

dialogue.name: WOMAN01374
dialogue.text: (-Bedraggled Woman-)<cough> <cough> Where...am I? Where is Robyn? Where is my son!?

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: Now ye just calm yerself down, goodwife. We'll have yer boy back in yer arms afore ye can spit up another lungful of seawater.

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: The tide's been merciful to a fortunate few like the goodwife here, an' carried them all the way to the beach.

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: Here. Ye'll be needin' some o' me medical supplies for the bleedin' an' the injured. Take a walk along the coast, now, an' help them as ain't beyond helpin'.

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: Ye didn't spy any little ones amongst the survivors, did ye? A shame, it is. A damn shame...

dialogue.name: WOMAN01374
dialogue.text: (-Bedraggled Woman-)Have you seen my little Robyn? I was certain I held him tightly as we fell into the water. So very, very tightly...

dialogue.name: VICTIMA01374
dialogue.text: <cough> <splutter> Ugh...

dialogue.name: VICTIMA01374
dialogue.text: I... I made it? One moment we was sailin' along, happy as ye please...the next, I was strugglin' to keep me head above the waves...

dialogue.name: VICTIMB01374
dialogue.text: <gasp> <wheeze> I can...barely breathe...

dialogue.name: VICTIMB01374
dialogue.text: <cough> <pant> Thank you...thank you... Which of the seven heavens is this? Bloodshore? Oh...

dialogue.name: INJURERA01374
dialogue.text: Ugh... Wave slammed me into the rocks... They cut me up some, I think. Is it bad...?

dialogue.name: INJURERA01374
dialogue.text:
My thanks. I feel much stronger now.
...All I remember is an impact like bloody thunder, and the deck lurching beneath my feet. Then they came aboard.

dialogue.name: INJURERB01374
dialogue.text: Argh! Me shoulder! It burns! Don't take me arm, I'm beggin' ye!

dialogue.name: INJURERB01374
dialogue.text: Ah, I can feel me fingers again. Those gutless fishbacks! They were over the rail and swingin' afore I could stammer out a prayer to the Navigator.

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: Ye've saved some lives this day, lasslad. 'Tis a terrible thing what happened, but ye take what solace ye can in the little victories.

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: ...Not that any amount o' solace'll have me forgivin' those blasted fishbacks. Ye expect attacks on the navy─that's what we signed up for─but sinkin' a civilian ship with women an' children aboard... The Sahagin have ice water for blood, I tell ye.

dialogue.name: WOMAN01374
dialogue.text: (-Bedraggled Woman-)<sob> No... Not my little Robyn...

dialogue.name: WILTFAL
dialogue.text: Me condolences, goodwife, I know how hard this must─

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: Leviathan's scaly arse!

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: Sahagin! Here!?

dialogue.name: SAHUAGIN01374
dialogue.text: (-Band of Sahagin-)Pshhh... Pshhh...

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: What, ye didn't get yer fill o' slaughter out on the strait!? If ye want to finish the job ye started, then ye'd best start with me!

dialogue.name: NOVV
dialogue.text: (-Sahagin Warrior-)Pshhh...

dialogue.name: ROBYN
dialogue.text: (-Lively Lad-)Mum!

dialogue.name: WOMAN01374
dialogue.text: (-Bedraggled Woman-)Robyn!? My darling Robyn!

dialogue.name: ROBYN
dialogue.text: (-Robyn-)Mum! There you are!

dialogue.name: WOMAN01374
dialogue.text: (-Bedraggled Woman-)Oh, my dear Robyn, you're safe! Thank the Twelve above!

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: The lad's alive!? What manner o' fishback trickery is this!?

dialogue.name: ROBYN
dialogue.text: I'm fine, if a bit wet! I thought I would sink right to the bottom of the sea, but then some nice fishmen came and saved me!

dialogue.name: ROBYN
dialogue.text: They were naught like the scary ones that came after our ship! But the stories say that all the fishmen are nasty... Isn't that odd?

dialogue.name: ROBYN
dialogue.text: Um, might I ask you a favor?

dialogue.name: ROBYN
dialogue.text: I found this necklace at the bottom of the little boat the nice fishmen used to carry me to the shore. I'm certain it must be one of theirs!

dialogue.name: ROBYN
dialogue.text: I'd take it back to them myself, but I don't think my mum would like that... Could you maybe return it for me?

dialogue.name: ROBYN
dialogue.text: The last I saw, they were swimming towards western La Noscea. That must be where they live! I wonder if their houses are made of seaweed!

dialogue.name: ROBYN
dialogue.text: Please don't hurt those fishmen─they're some of the nice ones! Even if they did smell a bit like rotting crabmeat... Heh heh.

dialogue.name: WOMAN01374
dialogue.text: (-Bedraggled Woman-)My precious boy...I thought him lost to the sea. I shall praise the mercy of the Navigator morn and eve for the rest of my days.

dialogue.name: WILTFALK
dialogue.text: Why would the fishbacks save the child of their enemy? It makes not a lick o' sense. Those heartless bottom-feeders are up to somethin'. Somethin' devious...

dialogue.name: SAHUAGINGATEMAN01374
dialogue.text: What is the meaning of this tressspass!? I should ssskewer you where you ssstand, finless one!

dialogue.name: SAHUAGINGATEMAN01374
dialogue.text: Pshhh! You carry the necklace of Clutchfather Novv! How is it that you possess this cherished treasure?

dialogue.name: SAHUAGINGATEMAN01374
dialogue.text: ...You come at the behest of the child he sssaved? Sssuch unusual manners for a shhhorewalker.

dialogue.name: SAHUAGINGATEMAN01374
dialogue.text: Pshhh... You may pass. Ssseek out Clutchfather Novv and be shhhure to keep your tone respectful─he is the elder of our clan.

dialogue.name: SAHUAGINGATEMAN01374
dialogue.text: Pshhh... You shhhow courage, finless one. Few shhhorewalkers would so boldly approach our settlement. Go, ssseek out Clutchfather Novv and make no trouble.

dialogue.name: NOVV
dialogue.text: Pshhhahaha. Rare it is to sssee a shhhorewalker in our midst. I am Novv, clutchfather to this clan of ssspawnlings. Ah, the finless child bid you return my necklace, did he?

dialogue.name: NOVV
dialogue.text: Pshhh? No, I had no ssspecial reason for sssaving the boy. Only that for the Sahagin─as it is for you shhhorewalkers─offspring are considered the most preciousss of treasures.

dialogue.name: NOVV
dialogue.text: All that reside here are bound by ties of blood. All are the children of the clutchfather.

dialogue.name: NOVV
dialogue.text: Only ssslightly less precious to me than my ssspawn is the trinket you bring. It was a gift─a commendation from our beloved matriarch. I thank you for returning it to me.

dialogue.name: NOVV
dialogue.text: We have a sssaying: “The favor of one is repaid by the gratitude of the clutch.” Pshhh... I welcome you to our home.

dialogue.name: NOVV
dialogue.text: Perhapsss a modest banquet is in order. I do not know, however, if our ssspread will agree with your shhhorewalker ssstomach! Pshhhahaha!
